briefTitle: Examining the Long Term Safety, Efficacy, and Corticosteroid-sparing Effect of Certolizumab Pegol in Crohn's Disease

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Patients previously enrolled in C87059 (COSPAR I, NCT00349752)

Exclusion Criteria:

* Subject withdrawn or discontinued from C87059 (COSPAR I, NCT00349752) study under specific conditions
* Subject who received treatment other than study medication and other than medications permitted in C87059 (COSPAR I, NCT00349752)
* Subjects from countries where certolizumab pegol is authorized in Crohn's disease treatment

outcomeMeasures.title: Occurrence of at Least One Treatment-emergent Adverse Event During This Study (Maximum 122 Weeks)
outcomeMeasures.description: Results are presented as the number of subjects with at least one treatment-emergent adverse event during this study.

outcomeMeasures.title: Disease Remission (Crohn's Disease Activity Index, CDAIâ‰¤150) at Week 34 in Patients Who Completed/Did Not Complete C87059 (COSPAR I, NCT00349752) and Remained Off Corticosteroids.
outcomeMeasures.description: Crohn's disease activity index (CDAI) is used to quantify the symptoms of Crohn's disease. A score of 150 or below indicates remission and a score above 450 indicates extremely severe disease. Results are presented as the percentage of subjects in disease remission at Week 34.
